Title:
Discovery of Cytospora species associated with canker disease
of tree hosts from Mount Dongling of China
Abstract:
Members of Cytospora encompass important plant pathogens,
saprobes and endophytes on a wide range of woody hosts with a worldwide
distribution. Cytospora species are difficult to differentiate since the
overlap morphological characteristics. In the current study, we obtained
seven representative isolates from six tree hosts of Betulaceae,
Juglandaceae, Rosaceae, Tiliaceae and Ulmaceae in Mount Dongling of
China. Based on morphological comparison and phylogenetic analyses using
partial ITS, LSU, act, rpb2, tef1-Î± and tub2 gene sequences, we
identified two known species (Cytospora leucostoma and C. pruinopsis)
and two novel species (C. coryleae and C. spiraeicola). These results
represent the first study on Cytospora species associated with canker
disease from the Mount Dongling of China.
